fu.esi

Class IMI_NearIndex_Int

  • java.lang.Object
    • fu.esi.IMI_NearIndex_Int

  • public class IMI_NearIndex_Int
extends java.lang.Object
    A NearIndex allows to query for the nearest object to a certain point. This index fully resides in memory (IMI, In-Memory-Index). The index is based on Voronoi diagrams. For each point, the MBR of the respective Voronoi region (if closed) is stored in an Extended Split Index. For infinite Voronoi regions an MBR with the maximum search distance is stored.

      Reads the entire index structure from stream.

      Creates an in-memory NearIndex.

    • Constructor Detail

      • IMI_NearIndex_Int

        public IMI_NearIndex_Int(double maxMeters)
        Creates an in-memory NearIndex.
        Parameters:
        maxMeters - maximum distance after which the nearest is not of interest any more (i.e. MBR distance for objects at the border)

      • IMI_NearIndex_Int

        public IMI_NearIndex_Int(java.io.DataInputStream in)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the entire index structure from stream. It formerly has to be written by writeToStream.
        Parameters:
        in - the input
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - read error from stream

    • Method Detail

      • writeToStream

        public void writeToStream(java.io.DataOutputStream out)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Write the entire index structure to stream. Later, an index can be instantiated with a formerly written structure.
        Parameters:
        out - the output
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - write error to stream

      • register

        public void register(int id,
                     double lat,
                     double lon)
        Register an object for a certain point. Later it can be searched by another point, if this object is the nearest.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID
        lat - point latitude
        lon - point longitude

      • close

        public void close()
        The list of registered objects is complete and the index now can be searched. It is not possible to register new objects.

      • getNearestTo

        public DDDI getNearestTo(double lat,
                         double lon)
        Get the nearest object to the given point, if there is one inside a circle of maxMeters
        Parameters:
        lat - point latitude
        lon - point longitude
        Returns:
        an object that contains the geo object and the distance in meters to the given point (d1) and the coordinate of the object (d2, d3). null, if there is no inside maxMeters
